title: 108_hr3054
content: The Act titled "District of Columbia Military Retirement Equity Act of 2003" permits the inclusion of previous military service as creditable service for certain District of Columbia retirees. The Policemen and Firemen's Retirement and Disability Act is amended to allow members to retain credit for military service by paying 7 percent of basic pay. The Policemen and Firemen's Retirement and Disability Act allows members to retain credit for military service by paying a percentage of basic pay. Payment must be completed before retirement or October 1, 2006, for credit retention. Military service interruptions can affect creditable service and reemployment. The deposit payable under this clause should not exceed the amount that would have been deducted from basic pay during the creditable service period if military service was not performed. Any deposit made more than 2 years after October 1, 2004, should include interest computed annually. The interest rate is determined by the applicable rate for the year. The Secretary of Commerce or Health and Human Services will provide necessary information to the Mayor for administering this subsection. The percentage of basic pay for military service after November 10, 1996, will be equal to the percentage applicable under subsection (d) for that period. Adjustment in federal benefit payments for police and fire retirees to account for military service adjustment. The National Capital Revitalization and Self-Government Improvement Act of 1997 is amended to include treatment of military service credit purchased by certain police and fire retirees in federal benefit payments. Additionally, a conforming amendment is made to section 11003(5) of the Act. The National Capital Revitalization and Self-Government Improvement Act of 1997 is amended to include treatment of military service credit purchased by certain police and fire retirees in federal benefit payments. The amendments made by this section shall apply to Federal benefit payments made after the date of the enactment of this Act.
